003package choreo.auto;
004
005import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
006
007import choreo.Choreo.TrajectoryCache;
008import choreo.Choreo.TrajectoryLogger;
009import choreo.trajectory.SwerveSample;
010import choreo.trajectory.Trajectory;
011import choreo.trajectory.TrajectorySample;
012import edu.wpi.first.hal.FRCNetComm.tResourceType;
013import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
015import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
016import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation.Alliance;
017import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase;
018import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
019import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
020import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Commands;
021import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem;
022import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button.Trigger;
023import java.util.HashMap;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Optional;
026import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
027import java.util.function.Consumer;
028import java.util.function.Supplier;
029
030/**
031 * A factory used to create {@link AutoRoutine}s and {@link AutoTrajectory}s.
032 *
033 * @see <a href="https://choreo.autos/choreolib/auto-routines">Auto Routine Docs</a>
034 */
035public class AutoFactory {
036  static final AutoRoutine VOID_ROUTINE =
037      new AutoRoutine(null, "VOID-ROUTINE", new EventLoop()) {
038        @Override
039        public Command cmd() {
040          return Commands.none().withName("VoidAutoRoutine");
041        }
042
043        @Override
044        public Command cmd(BooleanSupplier _finishCondition) {
045          return cmd();
046        }
047
048        @Override
049        public void poll() {}
050
051        @Override
052        public void reset() {}
053
054        @Override
055        public Trigger running() {
056          return new Trigger(loop, () -> false);
057        }
058      };
059
060  /** A class used to bind commands to events in all trajectories created by this factory. */
061  public static class AutoBindings {
062    private HashMap<String, Command> bindings = new HashMap<>();
063
064    /** Default constructor. */
065    public AutoBindings() {}
066
067    /**
068     * Binds a command to an event in all trajectories created by the factory using this bindings.
069     *
070     * @param name The name of the event to bind the command to.
071     * @param cmd The command to bind to the event.
072     * @return The bindings object for chaining.
073     */
074    public AutoBindings bind(String name, Command cmd) {
075      bindings.put(name, cmd);
076      return this;
077    }
078
079    private void merge(AutoBindings other) {
080      if (other == null) {
081        return;
082      }
083      bindings.putAll(other.bindings);
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * Gets the bindings map.
088     *
089     * @return The bindings map.
090     */
091    HashMap<String, Command> getBindings() {
092      return bindings;
093    }
094  }
095
096  private final TrajectoryCache trajectoryCache = new TrajectoryCache();
097  private final Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier;
098  private final Consumer<Pose2d> resetOdometry;
099  private final Consumer<? extends TrajectorySample<?>> controller;
100  private final Supplier<Optional<Alliance>> alliance;
101  private final BooleanSupplier useAllianceFlipping;
102  private final Subsystem driveSubsystem;
103  private final AutoBindings bindings = new AutoBindings();
104  private final TrajectoryLogger<? extends TrajectorySample<?>> trajectoryLogger;
105
106  /**
107   * Create a factory that can be used to create {@link AutoRoutine} and {@link AutoTrajectory}.
108   *
109   * @param <SampleType> The type of samples in the trajectory.
110   * @param poseSupplier A function that returns the current field-relative {@link Pose2d} of the
111   *     robot.
112   * @param resetOdometry A function that receives a field-relative {@link Pose2d} to reset the
113   *     robot's odometry to.
114   * @param controller A function that receives the current {@link SampleType} and controls the
115   *     robot.
116   * @param driveSubsystem The drive {@link Subsystem} to require for {@link AutoTrajectory} {@link
117   *     Command}s.
118   * @param useAllianceFlipping If this returns true, when on the red alliance, the path will be
119   *     mirrored to the opposite side, while keeping the same coordinate system origin. This will
120   *     be called every loop during the command.
121   * @param bindings Universal trajectory event bindings.
122   * @param trajectoryLogger A {@link TrajectoryLogger} to log {@link Trajectory} as they start and
123   *     finish.
124   * @param alliance A custom supplier of the current alliance to use instead of {@link
125   *     DriverStation#getAlliance}.
126   * @see AutoChooser using this factory with AutoChooser to generate auto routines.
127   */
128  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoFactory(
129      Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier,
130      Consumer<Pose2d> resetOdometry,
131      Consumer<SampleType> controller,
132      BooleanSupplier useAllianceFlipping,
133      Subsystem driveSubsystem,
134      AutoBindings bindings,
135      TrajectoryLogger<SampleType> trajectoryLogger,
136      Supplier<Optional<Alliance>> alliance) {
137    requireNonNullParam(poseSupplier, "poseSupplier", "AutoFactory");
138    requireNonNullParam(resetOdometry, "resetOdometry", "AutoFactory");
139    requireNonNullParam(controller, "controller", "AutoFactory");
140    requireNonNullParam(driveSubsystem, "driveSubsystem", "AutoFactory");
141    requireNonNullParam(useAllianceFlipping, "useAllianceFlipping", "AutoFactory");
142    requireNonNullParam(bindings, "bindings", "AutoFactory");
143
144    this.poseSupplier = poseSupplier;
145    this.resetOdometry = resetOdometry;
146    this.controller = controller;
147    this.driveSubsystem = driveSubsystem;
148    this.useAllianceFlipping = useAllianceFlipping;
149    this.bindings.merge(bindings);
150    this.trajectoryLogger = trajectoryLogger;
151    this.alliance = alliance;
152    HAL.report(tResourceType.kResourceType_ChoreoTrigger, 1);
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Create a factory that can be used to create {@link AutoRoutine} and {@link AutoTrajectory}.
157   *
158   * @param <SampleType> The type of samples in the trajectory.
159   * @param poseSupplier A function that returns the current field-relative {@link Pose2d} of the
160   *     robot.
161   * @param resetOdometry A function that receives a field-relative {@link Pose2d} to reset the
162   *     robot's odometry to.
163   * @param controller A function that receives the current {@link SampleType} and controls the
164   *     robot.
165   * @param driveSubsystem The drive {@link Subsystem} to require for {@link AutoTrajectory} {@link
166   *     Command}s.
167   * @param useAllianceFlipping If this returns true, when on the red alliance, the path will be
168   *     mirrored to the opposite side, while keeping the same coordinate system origin. This will
169   *     be called every loop during the command.
170   * @param bindings Universal trajectory event bindings.
171   * @param trajectoryLogger A {@link TrajectoryLogger} to log {@link Trajectory} as they start and
172   *     finish.
173   * @see AutoChooser using this factory with AutoChooser to generate auto routines.
174   */
175  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoFactory(
176      Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier,
177      Consumer<Pose2d> resetOdometry,
178      Consumer<SampleType> controller,
179      BooleanSupplier useAllianceFlipping,
180      Subsystem driveSubsystem,
181      AutoBindings bindings,
182      TrajectoryLogger<SampleType> trajectoryLogger) {
183    this(
184        poseSupplier,
185        resetOdometry,
186        controller,
187        useAllianceFlipping,
188        driveSubsystem,
189        bindings,
190        trajectoryLogger,
191        DriverStation::getAlliance);
192  }
193
194  /**
195   * Create a factory that can be used to create {@link AutoRoutine} and {@link AutoTrajectory}.
196   *
197   * @param <SampleType> The type of samples in the trajectory.
198   * @param poseSupplier A function that returns the current field-relative {@link Pose2d} of the
199   *     robot.
200   * @param resetOdometry A function that receives a field-relative {@link Pose2d} to reset the
201   *     robot's odometry to.
202   * @param controller A function that receives the current {@link SampleType} and controls the
203   *     robot.
204   * @param driveSubsystem The drive {@link Subsystem} to require for {@link AutoTrajectory} {@link
205   *     Command}s.
206   * @param useAllianceFlipping If this returns true, when on the red alliance, the path will be
207   *     mirrored to the opposite side, while keeping the same coordinate system origin. This will
208   *     be called every loop during the command.
209   * @param bindings Universal trajectory event bindings.
210   * @see AutoChooser using this factory with AutoChooser to generate auto routines.
211   */
212  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoFactory(
213      Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier,
214      Consumer<Pose2d> resetOdometry,
215      Consumer<SampleType> controller,
216      BooleanSupplier useAllianceFlipping,
217      Subsystem driveSubsystem,
218      AutoBindings bindings) {
219    this(
220        poseSupplier,
221        resetOdometry,
222        controller,
223        useAllianceFlipping,
224        driveSubsystem,
225        bindings,
226        (sample, isStart) -> {},
227        DriverStation::getAlliance);
228  }
229
230  /**
231   * Creates a new {@link AutoRoutine}.
232   *
233   * @param name The name of the {@link AutoRoutine}.
234   * @return A new {@link AutoRoutine}.
235   */
236  public AutoRoutine newRoutine(String name) {
237    // Clear cache in simulation to allow a form of "hot-reloading" trajectories
238    if (RobotBase.isSimulation()) {
239      trajectoryCache.clear();
240    }
241
242    return new AutoRoutine(this, name, this::allianceKnownOrIgnored);
243  }
244
245  private boolean allianceKnownOrIgnored() {
246    return !useAllianceFlipping.getAsBoolean() || alliance.get().isPresent();
247  }
248
249  /**
250   * A package protected method to create a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an {@link
251   * AutoRoutine}.
252   *
253   * @see AutoRoutine#trajectory(String)
254   */
255  AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName, AutoRoutine routine) {
256    Optional<? extends Trajectory<?>> optTrajectory =
257        trajectoryCache.loadTrajectory(trajectoryName);
258    Trajectory<?> trajectory;
259    if (optTrajectory.isPresent()) {
260      trajectory = optTrajectory.get();
261    } else {
262      trajectory = new Trajectory<SwerveSample>(trajectoryName, List.of(), List.of(), List.of());
263    }
264    return trajectory(trajectory, routine);
265  }
266
267  /**
268   * A package protected method to create a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an {@link
269   * AutoRoutine}.
270   *
271   * @see AutoRoutine#trajectory(String, int)
272   */
273  AutoTrajectory trajectory(String trajectoryName, final int splitIndex, AutoRoutine routine) {
274    Optional<? extends Trajectory<?>> optTrajectory =
275        trajectoryCache.loadTrajectory(trajectoryName, splitIndex);
276    Trajectory<?> trajectory;
277    if (optTrajectory.isPresent()) {
278      trajectory = optTrajectory.get();
279    } else {
280      trajectory = new Trajectory<SwerveSample>(trajectoryName, List.of(), List.of(), List.of());
281    }
282    return trajectory(trajectory, routine);
283  }
284
285  /**
286   * A package protected method to create a new {@link AutoTrajectory} to be used in an {@link
287   * AutoRoutine}.
288   *
289   * @see AutoRoutine#trajectory(Trajectory)
290   */
291  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
292  <ST extends TrajectorySample<ST>> AutoTrajectory trajectory(
293      Trajectory<ST> trajectory, AutoRoutine routine) {
294    // type solidify everything
295    final Trajectory<ST> solidTrajectory = trajectory;
296    final Consumer<ST> solidController = (Consumer<ST>) this.controller;
297    return new AutoTrajectory(
298        trajectory.name(),
299        solidTrajectory,
300        poseSupplier,
301        resetOdometry,
302        solidController,
303        useAllianceFlipping,
304        alliance,
305        (TrajectoryLogger<ST>) trajectoryLogger,
306        driveSubsystem,
307        routine,
308        bindings);
309  }
310
311  /**
312   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} command to be used in an auto routine.
313   *
314   * <p><b>Important </b>
315   *
316   * <p>{@link #trajectoryCommand} and {@link #trajectory} methods should not be mixed in the same
317   * auto routine. {@link #trajectoryCommand} is used as an escape hatch for teams that don't need
318   * the benefits of the {@link #trajectory} method and its {@link Trigger} API. {@link
319   * #trajectoryCommand} does not invoke bindings added via calling {@link #bind} or {@link
320   * AutoBindings} passed into the factory constructor.
321   *
322   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
323   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
324   */
325  public Command trajectoryCommand(String trajectoryName) {
326    return trajectory(trajectoryName, VOID_ROUTINE).cmd();
327  }
328
329  /**
330   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} command to be used in an auto routine.
331   *
332   * <p><b>Important </b>
333   *
334   * <p>{@link #trajectoryCommand} and {@link #trajectory} methods should not be mixed in the same
335   * auto routine. {@link #trajectoryCommand} is used as an escape hatch for teams that don't need
336   * the benefits of the {@link #trajectory} method and its {@link Trigger} API. {@link
337   * #trajectoryCommand} does not invoke bindings added via calling {@link #bind} or {@link
338   * AutoBindings} passed into the factory constructor.
339   *
340   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
341   * @param splitIndex The index of the split trajectory to use.
342   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
343   */
344  public Command trajectoryCommand(String trajectoryName, final int splitIndex) {
345    return trajectory(trajectoryName, splitIndex, VOID_ROUTINE).cmd();
346  }
347
348  /**
349   * Creates a new {@link AutoTrajectory} command to be used in an auto routine.
350   *
351   * <p><b>Important </b>
352   *
353   * <p>{@link #trajectoryCommand} and {@link #trajectory} methods should not be mixed in the same
354   * auto routine. {@link #trajectoryCommand} is used as an escape hatch for teams that don't need
355   * the benefits of the {@link #trajectory} method and its {@link Trigger} API. {@link
356   * #trajectoryCommand} does not invoke bindings added via calling {@link #bind} or {@link
357   * AutoBindings} passed into the factory constructor.
358   *
359   * @param <SampleType> The type of the trajectory samples.
360   * @param trajectory The trajectory to use.
361   * @return A new {@link AutoTrajectory}.
362   */
363  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> Command trajectoryCommand(
364      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory) {
365    return trajectory(trajectory, VOID_ROUTINE).cmd();
366  }
367
368  /**
369   * Creates a command that resets the robot's odometry to the start of a trajectory.
370   *
371   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
372   * @return A command that resets the robot's odometry.
373   */
374  public Command resetOdometry(String trajectoryName) {
375    return trajectory(trajectoryName, VOID_ROUTINE).resetOdometry();
376  }
377
378  /**
379   * Creates a command that resets the robot's odometry to the start of a trajectory.
380   *
381   * @param trajectoryName The name of the trajectory to use.
382   * @param splitIndex The index of the split trajectory to use.
383   * @return A command that resets the robot's odometry.
384   */
385  public Command resetOdometry(String trajectoryName, final int splitIndex) {
386    return trajectory(trajectoryName, splitIndex, VOID_ROUTINE).resetOdometry();
387  }
388
389  /**
390   * Creates a command that resets the robot's odometry to the start of a trajectory.
391   *
392   * @param <SampleType> The type of the trajectory samples.
393   * @param trajectory The trajectory to use.
394   * @return A command that resets the robot's odometry.
395   */
396  public <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> Command resetOdometry(
397      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory) {
398    return trajectory(trajectory, VOID_ROUTINE).resetOdometry();
399  }
400
401  /**
402   * Creates an {@link AutoRoutine} with the name of the command. The command is the bound to the
403   * routine's enabled trigger. This is useful for adding a {@link Command} composition based auto
404   * to the {@link choreo.auto.AutoChooser}.
405   *
406   * @param cmd The command to bind to the routine.
407   * @return A new auto routine.
408   */
409  public AutoRoutine commandAsAutoRoutine(Command cmd) {
410    AutoRoutine routine = newRoutine(cmd.getName());
411    routine.running().onTrue(cmd);
412    return routine;
413  }
414
415  /**
416   * Binds a command to an event in all trajectories created after this point.
417   *
418   * @param name The name of the trajectory to bind the command to.
419   * @param cmd The command to bind to the trajectory.
420   */
421  public void bind(String name, Command cmd) {
422    bindings.bind(name, cmd);
423  }
424
425  /**
426   * The {@link AutoFactory} caches trajectories with a {@link TrajectoryCache} to avoid reloading
427   * the same trajectory multiple times.
428   *
429   * @return The trajectory cache.
430   */
431  public TrajectoryCache cache() {
432    return trajectoryCache;
433  }
434}
